page.title: 07HOMELIFE IN TREDEGAR(cont..)
page.content: Many homes have labour saving machines. these machines help save the work in the house such as decorating and dish-washing. They also save work in the garden. We made a list of 16 hat we have in our homes. There are many different foods to buy and cook in 1985. In Tredegar we have 3 supermarkets, 2 hypermarkets, 6 cornershops, takeaways-indian snd chinese and hotels for food and drink. We cook food on either gas, electric or microwave cookers. There are more parents working than unemployed. More families are buying houses than renting them. Most of us save in building society or banks. Many of us have pocket money of about 1 to 5 pounds. Most children in our class have pets. some have more than one. Alot of people buy pet food.
